DOC.brief_summary: A Clinical Study Evaluate Safety Performance TriVascular Ovation Abdominal Stent Graft System
DOC.brief_title: South American Abdominal Stent Graft Trial
DOC.detailed_description: This study prospective , non-randomized multi-center clinical evaluation safety performance TriVascular Modular Abdominal Stent Graft System use treatment subject abdominal aortic aneurysm ( AAA ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient > 18 year age 2 . Patients male nonpregnant female ( female child bear potential must negative pregnancy test prior enrollment study ) 3 . Patient sign Ethics Committee approve Informed Consent Form 4 . Patient consider treat physician candidate elective open surgical repair AAA ( i.e. , category I , II , III per American Society Anesthesiology ( ASA ) classification ; refer Appendix III : ASA Classification System ) . ASA category IV patient may enrol provided life expectancy great 1 year . 5 . Patient infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm meet least one following : 1 . Abdominal aortic aneurysm > 5.0 cm diameter , 2 . Aneurysm increase size 0.5 cm last 6 month , 3 . Maximum diameter aneurysm exceed 1.5 time transverse dimension adjacent normal aortic segment . 6 . Patient patent iliac femoral artery allow endovascular access TriVascular Ovation Abdominal Stent Graft System . 7 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal proximal aortic neck length ≥ 7 mm inferior distal renal artery ostium . 8 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal distal iliac artery length ( seal zone ) ≥ 10 mm . The resultant repair preserve patency least one hypogastric artery . 9 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal proximal aortic neck luminal diameter 16 30 mm . 10 . Patient suitable nonaneurysmal distal iliac luminal diameter 8 20 mm . 11 . Patient meet follow anatomic criterion : distance distal renal artery superior internal iliac artery measurement least 13 cm . 12 . Patient juxtarenal aortic neck angulation ≤ 60º proximal neck ≥ 10 mm ≤ 45 proximal neck < 10 mm . 13 . Patient must able willing comply require followup exam . 1 . Patient dissect aneurysm . 2 . Patient acutely rupture aneurysm . 3 . Patient acute vascular injury . 4 . Patient need emergent surgery . 5 . Patient known thoracic aortic aneurysm dissection . 6 . Patient mycotic aneurysm active systemic infection.. 7 . Patient unstable angina ( define angina progressive increase symptom , new onset rest nocturnal angina , onset prolonged angina ) 8 . Patient myocardial infarction ( MI ) and/or stroke ( CVA ) within past 6 month . 9 . Patient major surgical interventional procedure plan ≤ 30 day AAA repair . 10 . Patient history connective tissue disease ( e.g. , Marfan 's Ehler'sDanlos syndrome ) . 11 . Patient history bleed disorder refuse blood transfusion . 12 . Patient dialysis dependent renal failure baseline serum creatinine level > 2.0 mg/dl . 13 . Patient known hypersensitivity contraindication anticoagulation contrast medium amenable pretreatment . 14 . Patient know allergy intolerance polytetrafluoroethylene ( PTFE ) , PEGbased polymer , fluorinated ethylenepropylene ( FEP ) nitinol . 15 . Patient body habitus would inhibit Xray visualization aorta 16 . Patient limited life expectancy le 1 year 17 . Patient currently participate investigational device drug clinical trial . 18 . Patient medical , social psychological condition , opinion investigator , preclude receive pretreatment , require treatment , posttreatment procedure evaluation .
